alert.note: Alert for Hot Springs (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 07 at 6:46PM MDT until June 11 at 12:00PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: .Showers and thunderstorms became anchored along the Owl Creek Mountains late this afternoon. The result was heavy rain falling in extreme southern Hot Springs County. This rain is likely to cause minor flooding of creeks, streams, and arroyos within the Red Canyon Creek drainage. ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Wyoming, including the following county, Hot Springs. * WHEN...Until 1000 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Rises in small streams and normally dry washes and draws. Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 642 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain from earlier showers and thunderstorms. This is likely causing small stream flooding and flooding of normally dry washes. Total rainfall was estimated at 1.5 to 3 inches. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.25 inches are expected over the area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... mainly rural areas of extreme southern Hot Springs County
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Remain alert for flooding even in locations not receiving rain. Arroyos, streams, and rivers can become raging killer currents in a matter of minutes, even from distant rainfall.
